physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features a group of shoulder under a roofed shelter. The background of the photograph shows a clearing in a dense forest. In the shelter, the soldier on the right is proning on the ground, while aiming a weapon towards the left. Behind him, there are three other soldiers seated casually, and one soldier lying down on the left. The photograph is torn, especially on the top left and right corners.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Soldiers resting under shelter
subject_terms_1: world wars soldiers shelters (single built works)
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
